text: kabe śrī chaitanya more karibena dayā
translation: When will Śrī Chaitanya be merciful to me? When will I reach the shade of the Vaiṣṇavas’ feet?
When will I give up this mundane ego? When will I honour the Lord’s devotees?
With a cloth around my neck, joined palms, and straw between my teeth, I will sincerely submit myself at the Vaiṣṇava’s feet.
Weeping, I will convey my sorrows to the Vaiṣṇava and pray for shelter from the fire of material existence.
Hearing of my sorrow, the worshippable Vaiṣṇava will thoroughly pray to Kṛṣṇa on my behalf.

text: e hena pāmara prati habena sadaya
translation: Satisfied by the Vaiṣṇava’s prayer, Kṛṣṇa will be merciful to this sinner.

text: kṛpā kari’ saṅge laha ei akiñchane
translation: Bhakti Vinod prays at the feet of the Vaiṣṇavas: “Mercifully take this lowly soul with you.”
